result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kelly Scott Steinert #202824 was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
-Concurrent to 07CF36 and 09CF158.
-Defendant remanded into custody.
-Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

Apprs:CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Kelly Scott Steinert appeared from jail. Court reviews file and PSI. Atty. Chapman makes statement as to the PSI. DE has an open case in Polk County. ADA Hartung makes recommendations. DE makes statement. Court orders:
4 years total confinement.
2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision to run concurrent to 07CF36, 09CF158.
- Credit for 201 days. 
Conditions:
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular drug testing.
- DE not to be present in any tavern, bar, liquore stores, beer tents or  any place designed primarily for the sale of alcohol.
- Follow through with any programing recommended by agent.
- Fine of $1694.00 inclusive of costs to be paid through DOC
- $52.00 Blood draw to be paid through DOC
- Apply bond on file. 
- 27 mo. DL revocation
- 27 mo IID
- AODA and driver's safety 
DE remanded into custody. 
DE eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel J. Chapman   DF:  Kelly Scott Steinert appeared from jail. Set for final pre-trial. Includes 14CF98, 14CF388, 14TR291 and 14TR925. Cases called at 3:04 p.m. Plea Questionnaire filed. ADA Nieskes updates the Court. DE has pending Polk County matter. Attorneys request PSI. DE pleads no contest to Count 1 - OWI 5th in 14CF98. DE sworn.  Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Court accept plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Count 1 - OWI 5th in 14CF98. On motion of the State, Count 2 dismissed and Count 3 merged and dismissed in 14CF98. Court dismisses 14CF388, 14TR921, and 14TR925. Court orders PSI. Court sets for sentencing. Bail is revoked. DE remanded to SCC jail. Cash on file to remain at this time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Chapman. km
